pullrequest.title: add simplified duck_collider.dae mesh to improve collision checking performance

content.raw:
It seems that the orientation of the mesh was changed to be upright when it was simplified \(which is preferable, but it wasn’t accounted for in the sdf\).

I tweaked the sdf in [3b98921](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/3b9892182ca0a8cf31898db802c45e36eaf1db59?at=default) and now you should find that it works nicely.

This makes me suspect that the slow down isn’t that there are too many contact points, but rather Bullet just takes a long time to compute the contact points for large meshes.
